alert.note: Alert for Erie; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 9:16PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following counties, Erie and Lorain. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas near the Vermilion River and in Mill Hollow and Bacon Woods Parks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 PM EST, gauge reports indicated an ice jam. Minor flooding is already occurring near the advisory area. - - At 915 PM EST, gauge reports indicated an ice jam. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly near the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vermilion, Western Vermilion and Birmingham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vermilion, Western Vermilion and Birmingham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
